System and Function Block Diagrams

A Visual Representation Of The Core Design And Function Of Our Project.

Learn More
System Block Diagram
SBD Our system block diagram demonstrates the main core functionality of what our devices is supposed to do and how it operates. As shown we are designing a cushion that can be placed on an existing wheelchair, this cushion has a mechanical roller inside driven by a stepper motor and supported by a linear guide garriage. The motor is controlled by the microcontroller which the user interfaces with via a bluetooth connection with their phone.
Functional Block Diagram
FBD The functional block diagram shows a more detailed example of what's shown in the SBD. Following the flow of power through the system, with power coming from either a 12 V battery or a 24 V battery. This power is then either regulated to a voltage compatible with the microcontroller or fed into the motor driver. The microcontroller then gives power to the various modules as needed while handling the UART, GPIO, and STEP/DIR signals at a value 3.3 V.
Texas A&M University Capstone Project
